data.title: McKinley Birthplace Home (Niles)
data.meta_description: McKinley Birthplace Home is a museum in Niles. View visitor information, information about the collection and read reviews.
data.text:
The National McKinley Birthplace Memorial Library and Museum, also known as the McKinley Memorial Library, Museum & Birthplace Home, is a significant monument dedicated to President William McKinley. Located in Niles, Ohio, the memorial is a grand marble structure measuring 232 by 136 by 38 ft. It is divided into two wings, each serving a unique purpose in preserving and showcasing the life and legacy of President McKinley.

Features of the National McKinley Birthplace Memorial Library and Museum

The National McKinley Birthplace Memorial Library and Museum is divided into two wings. One wing is dedicated to the public McKinley Memorial Library, which houses a vast collection of books and resources. The other wing is home to the McKinley Museum, featuring a variety of exhibits about President McKinley. The museum also includes an auditorium for presentations and events.

Visiting Hours and Admission

The McKinley Memorial Library is accessible to the public six days a week, remaining closed on Sundays and certain holidays. Similarly, the McKinley Memorial Museum is open to the public from Tuesday to Friday, and there is no admission charge. These timings and policies ensure that visitors have ample opportunities to explore and learn from these historical sites.
